title: (x) Guinness Advert handwriting font - Flint's Hand {Mike Freiman}
content:
This typeface is apparently used in a Guinness print advert in the UK. The lower case 'g' looks familiar but I can't pick it. Can anyone help?   
 ![GuinnessScript](http://web.archive.org/web/20130312074039im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/your_image.gif)
author: skyrocket

comments.content:
That is Flint's Hand. [Here](http://web.archive.org/web/20130312074039/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/ListPages/HWFontAliases.html), on Mike Y's site is an   
explanation of where this font came from.   
   
My copy came from one of my first ever software   
 programs - a copy of Print Artist, which came   
 bundled with lots of those WSI fonts (Sierra later   
wised up and bundled legit URW fonts). Don't   
laugh

Mike,   
Thank you for that - Flint's Hand is the one alright. How you got that one is beyond me!   
Regards   
PAUL
